isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - HOOD, GRILLE, AND FENDERS - 5000, 9100, 9200, 9300, AND 9400 - ADJUSTMENTS - RADIATOR

step1.para: Release the hood latches and tilt the hood assembly forward.
Loosen the radiator stay rod adjustment bolts on each side of the radiator.
Adjust the radiator to obtain the correct angle and dimension ( Figure 70). Maintain the correct dimension with a spacer gauge (made locally) while tightening the adjustment bolts.
Close and latch the hood on both sides.

svcsubproc.title: 9200 and 9400 (After July 1996)
svcsubproc.para: After July 1996 the position of the radiator is fixed and cannot be adjusted.

svcsubproc.title: 5000 SFA (Before January 1994)
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 71 for all items in parentheses.

Adjust the radiator as follows: The correct dimension from the front edge of the stay rod bracket (Item 12) on top of the radiator to the center of the cowl stay rod bracket (Item 3) mounted at the center of the cowl is 44 inches (1117.6 mm) (Item 4).

para.title: TO INCREASE the cowl-to-radiator dimension (Item 4), lengthen the stay rods (Item 6).

step1.para: Release the hood latches and tilt the hood assembly to full open position.
Loosen and move forward the hex nut (Item 13) on the radiator side of the stay rod bracket (Item 12) on top of the radiator (Item 5).

Slide components (Items 8, 9, and 10) and spacer (Item 11) forward on both sides of the stay rod bracket (Item 12), check length, then move forward and tighten the hex nut (Item 7) on the stay rod side of the stay rod bracket.
Repeat procedure for the other stay rod.
Close and latch the hood on both sides.

para.title: TO DECREASE the cowl-to-radiator dimension (Item 4), shorten the stay rods (Item 6).

item.para: Release the hood latches and tilt the hood assembly to full open position.
Loosen and move rearward the hex nut (Item 7) on the stay rod side of the stay rod bracket (Item 12) on top of the radiator (Item 5).

Slide components (Items 8, 9, and 10) and spacer (Item 11) rearward on both sides of the stay rod bracket, check length, then move rearward, and tighten the hex nut (Item 13) on the radiator side of the stay rod bracket.
Repeat procedure for the other stay rod.
Close and latch the hood on both sides.

svcsubproc.title: 5000 SFA (After January 1994)
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 72 for all items in parentheses.
Adjust the radiator assembly angle as follows.

step1.para: Release the hood latches and tilt the hood assembly to full open position.
Loosen the mounting bolts (Item 1) at the stay rod bracket (Item 2) on both sides of the radiator (Item 3).
Move the top of the radiator (Item 3) forward or back to obtain an angle of 89 degrees or align the grille with the hood when closed. Tighten the mounting bolts (Item 1).
Close and latch the hood on both sides and check the clearance of the hood at the grille. If further adjustment is required, repeat this procedure.
When the proper hood-to-grille clearance is obtained, make sure the mounting bolts (Item 1) are tight at the stay rod bracket (Item 2) on both sides.
Close and latch the hood on both sides.

figure.caption: Figure 72. 5000 SFA (After January 1994) Stay Rod Bracket

svcsubproc.title: 5000 SBA (After August 1994) With Optional Butterfly Hood
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 73 for all items in parentheses.
Adjust the radiator shell assembly as follows.
The correct spacing for hood-to-cowl and hood-to-radiator shell dimensions is 1/2 inch (12.7 mm) in both places (Items C and D).
The correct radiator shell-to-cowl dimension is 50 inches (1,270 mm) (Item B).

para.title: TO INCREASE the radiator shell-to-cowl dimension (Item B), lengthen the stay rod.

step1.para: Release the hood latches and lift both sides of the hood up to allow access to the adjustment components at the cowl.
Loosen and move rearward the hex nut (Item 1) on the cowl side (Item 9) of the stay rod bracket (Item 5).

Slide components (Items 2, 3, and 4) and spacer (Item 6) rearward on both sides of the stay rod bracket, check length, then move rearward and tighten the hex nut (Item 7) on the stay rod side (Item 10) of the stay rod bracket.
Repeat procedure for the other stay rod.
Close and latch the hood.

para.title: TO DECREASE the radiator shell-to-cowl dimension (Item B), shorten the stay rod.

item.para: Release the hood latches and lift both sides of the hood up to allow access to the adjustment components at the cowl.
Loosen and move forward the hex nut (Item 7) on the stay rod side (Item 10) of the stay rod bracket (Item 5).

Slide components (Items 2, 3, and 4) and spacer (Item 6) forward on both sides of the stay rod bracket, check length, then move forward and tighten the hex nut (Item 1) on the cowl side (Item 9) of the stay rod bracket.
Repeat procedure for the other stay rod.

calloutgroup.callout1: B. RADIATOR SHELL-TO-COWL DIMENSION TO BE 50 INCHES (1,270 MM)
C. HOOD-TO-COWL DIMENSION TO BE 1/2 INCH (12.7 MM)
D. HOOD-TO-RADIATOR SHELL DIMENSION TO BE 1/2 INCH (12.7 MM)
9. COWL SIDE OF STAY ROD BRACKET
10. ROD SIDE OF STAY ROD BRACKET
